ART has transformed HIV/AIDS from a deadly pandemic to a treatable and potentially preventable disease.
1
,
2 Expanded access to ART has resulted in 25%–50% declines in global epidemics in heterosexual populations, raising optimism that treatment-as-prevention may arrest the pandemic by 2030 ( www.unaids.org).
3–7 The World Health Organization has advanced global ‘90–90–90’ targets for 2020 where 90% living with HIV-1 are informed of their status, 90% of infected individuals receive antiviral treatment and 90% of those treated achieve viral suppression ( www.unaids.org). HIV-1 guidelines have been revised to meet these objectives, recommending annual HIV testing, immediate treatment initiation and pre-exposure prophylaxis for high risk populations.
